meanings.definition: A person or thing that holds attention as if by a spell.
meanings.sent1: The magician was a true spellbinders during his performance.
meanings.sent2: The storyteller was a spellbinders, captivating the audience with her tales.
meanings.sent3: The spellbinders at the circus made everyone laugh with their silly tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like spellbinders, drawing you in with their mysterious gaze.
meanings.sent5: The painting was a spellbinders, each brushstroke telling a mesmerizing story.

meanings.sent1: In the fairy tale, the witch was known as a powerful spellbinders.
meanings.sent2: The wizard was a skilled spellbinders, able to enchant objects with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent3: The spellbinders in the story accidentally turned the prince into a frog.
meanings.sent4: The old book was a spellbinders, containing ancient incantations and magical recipes.
meanings.sent5: The spellbinders chanted under the full moon, invoking the spirits of the forest.
